CatDescriptText: Cutline of image published in Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, September 7, 1957, pg. 24, reads: "Courier Hosts Newsboys at Annual Picnic - Outing For Newsies - Nearly 200 newsboys and girls spent the entire day at South Park's Sully's Pool and Grove as guests of The Pittsburgh Courier at the annual Newsboys Picnic on Aug. 30. The picnic, a circulation-promotion project, under the supervision of A.D. (Jake) Gaither, circulation manager; William Clyde Page, promotion manager, and William G. Nunn Sr., coordinator, was acclaimed a huge success.  Assisting the aforementioned were Leroy Randalll [sic], Carl Davis, Lloyd Tobias, and Donald Williams, distributors, who were mainly responsible for the large turnout.  James D. Drake, promotion art director, acted as co-chairman of the program activities, along with Mr. Davis.  Others who volunteered their services as attendants were Mrs. Bernice Price, Mrs. Lloyd Tobias, Miss Valerie Stewart and Minister Robert X. Davenport of Muhammad Temple of Islam No. 24.  Plenty of good food, baseball, volleyball, and football games, assorted foot races, swimming and rock and roll music kept the newsboys and girls busy throughout the day.  Pictured above are... (2) Winners of the 20 outstanding Courier newsboys' prizes were, front row, left to right: Eddie Purdom, Charles Perry, Robert Price, James Norman, Donald Jones, Alton Dickson, and Roland Pryor.  Back row, left to right: Harold Wilkes, Ronald Johnson, Robert Jackson, Donald Wilkes, Wilbur Fultz, Eugene Nelson and Will Purdom.  The six boys and girls not shown are Jerry Robinson, Melvin Dukes, John Graves, Richard Goode, Harold Lavelle and Delores Becton... - Photos by Harris."
TitMainTitle: Boys, front row from left: Eddie Purdom, Charles Perry, Robert Price, James Norman, Donald Jones, Alton Dickson, Roland Pryor; back row: Harold Wilkes, Ronald Johnson, Robert Jackson, Donald Wilkes, Wilbur Fultz, Eugene Nelson, and Will Purdom, holding letters spelling "The Courier" at Pittsburgh Courier Newspaper Newsboy Annual Picnic, South Park
